arm_group.description:
500 mg PLACEBO PO 2 times a day for 1 week (Week 1)
1000 mg PLACEBO PO 2 times a day for 5 weeks (Weeks 2,3,4,5,6)

500 mg RANOLAZINE PO 2 times a day for 1 week (Week 1)
1000 mg RANOLAZINE PO 2 times a day for 5 weeks (Weeks 2,3,4,5,6)

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this trial is to determine if patients suffering from diabetic peripheral
      neuropathic pain treated with ranolazine will have a greater reduction in pain compared to
      placebo.

      Hypothesis: From the prior clinical observations, and analgesic efficacy in the preclinical
      animal model of neuropathic pain, the investigators hypothesize that subjects randomized to
      ranolazine will show a greater reduction in diabetic neuropathic pain compared to placebo.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ranolazine for Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathic Pain (DPNP)

intervention.description: Oral administration, BID; for a maximum of 51 days.
Oral administration, BID; for a maximum of 51 days.

clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Randomized, Parallel Assignment, U.S. Study of Ranolazine for the Treatment of Patients With Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathic Pain (DPNP)

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Fifty percent or greater reduction in the mean Numeric Rating Scale (11-point NRS 0-10) recorded in the subjects' diaries from ranolazine compared to placebo.

reference.citation: Gould HJ 3rd, Garrett C, Donahue RR, Paul D, Diamond I, Taylor BK. Ranolazine attenuates behavioral signs of neuropathic pain. Behav Pharmacol. 2009 Dec;20(8):755-8. doi: 10.1097/FBP.0b013e3283323c90. PubMed

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life Assessment as measured by SF-36 v2
Change in pain assessment measured by the Visual Analog Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization (Day 0), Day 14, Day 28, Day 42, and Day 56

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pain assessment measured by Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.description: Pain reduction of ranolazine versus placebo in subjects with diabetic peripheral neuropathic pain (DPNP) and arterial ischemia compared to those with DPNP without arterial ischemia.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pain of patients with arterial ischemia measured by Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization (Day 0), Day 14, Day 28, Day 42, and Day 56

secondary_outcome.description: Additional pain medication after the baseline visit as needed for pain reduction in addition to the study drug.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization (Day 0), Day 14, Day 28, Day 42, and Day 56

secondary_outcome.description: The rates and severity of Adverse Events (AEs) from Randomization (Day 0) through Termination (Day 56)
secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of Adverse Events after randomization

secondary_outcome.description:
A serious adverse event (SAE), also may be called a serious adverse drug reaction, is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose:
results in death,
is life-threatening,
requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization,
results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or
is a congenital anomaly/birth defect.
secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of Serious Adverse Events after randomization

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
